revisions.rev:
{{Primary sources|date=June 2011}} {{lowercase|title=wxWidgets}} {{Infobox software | name = wxWidgets | logo = [[File:wxWidgets.svg|128px]] | screenshot = | caption = | collapsible = | author = | developer = [http://wxwidgets.org/about/whowhat.htm wxWidgets Developers and Contributors] | released = {{Start date and age|1992}} | discontinued = | latest_release_version = 2.8.12 | latest_release_date = {{release date and age|2011|03|28}} | latest_preview_version = 2.9.2 | latest_preview_date = {{release date and age|2011|07|05}} | frequently_updated = | programming_language = [[C++]] | operating_system = [[Cross-platform]] | platform = | size = | language = | status = Active | genre = Development [[Library (computing)|library]] | license = [[wxWindows license]] | website = {{URL|wxwidgets.org}} }} '''wxWidgets''' (formerly '''wxWindows''') is a [[widget toolkit]] for creating [[graphical user interface]]s (GUIs) for [[cross-platform]] applications. wxWidgets enables a program's GUI code to compile and run on several computer platforms with minimal or no [[source code|code]] changes. It covers systems such as [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Mac OS X]] ([[Carbon_(API)|Carbon]] and [[Cocoa_(API)|Cocoa]]), [[IOS_(Apple)|iOS]] ([[Cocoa Touch]]), [[Linux]]/[[Unix]] ([[X11]], [[Motif (widget toolkit)|Motif]], and [[GTK+]]), [[OpenVMS]], [[OS/2]] and [[AmigaOS]]. A version for [[embedded system]]s is under development.{{cite web|url=http://www.wxwidgets.org/docs/embedded.htm |title=wxEmbedded: wxWidgets for embedded applications |accessdate=2007-04-23 |publisher=Sourceforge.net }} wxWidgets is used across many industry sectors, most notably by [[Xerox]], [[Advanced Micro Devices]] (AMD), [[Lockheed Martin]], [[NASA]] and the [[Center for Naval Analyses]]. It is also used in the public sector and education by, for example, [[Dartmouth Medical School]], [[National Human Genome Research Institute]], [[National Center for Biotechnology Information]], and many others.{{cite web|title=About Who uses wxWidgets?|url=http://www.wxwidgets.org/about/whouses.htm|publisher=wxWidgets.org|accessdate=2011-04-12}} wxWidgets is used in many open source projects,{{cite web|title=List of open source applications that uses wxWidgets|url=http://sourceforge.net/softwaremap/?&fq%5B%5D=trove%3A481|publisher=SourceForge.net|accessdate=2011-04-22}} as well as by the individual developers. A wide choice of compilers and other tools to use with wxWidgets, allows development of highly sophisticated applications on a tight budget. It is [[Free software|free]] and [[open source software]], distributed under the terms of the [[wxWidgets#License|wxWidgets license]], which satisfies those who wish to produce [[GNU General Public License|GPL]] software, and also those producing [[proprietary software]]. ==History== wxWidgets (initially wxWindows) was started in 1992 by Julian Smart at the [[University of Edinburgh]].{{cite web |url=http://wxwidgets.org/about/ |title=About the wxWidgets Project |publisher=wxwidgets.org |accessdate=2010-01-02 }} He attained an honours degree in [[Computational science]] from the [[University of St Andrews]] in 1986, and is still a core developer.{{cite web|url=http://www.anthemion.co.uk/julian.htm |title=About Julian Smart, www.anthemion.co.uk |publisher=Anthemion.co.uk |date=1964-03-27 |accessdate=2009-06-08}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bookfayre.cz/books/name/julian_smart.2247651.html.cs |title=Julian Smart |publisher=Bookfayre.cz |date= |accessdate=2009-06-08}} On February 20, 2004, the developers of wxWindows announced that the project was changing its name to ''wxWidgets'', as a result of [[Microsoft]] requesting Julian Smart to respect Microsoft's [[United Kingdom]] [[trademark]] of the term ''Windows''.{{cite web | url = http://wxwidgets.org/about/name.htm |title=Name change |accessdate=2007-04-23 |last=Smart |first=Julian |coauthors=Robin Dunn |month=August | year=2004 |publisher=Sourceforge.net }} Major release versions were 2.4 on 6 January 2003, 2.6 on 21 April 2005 and 2.8.0 on 14 December 2006. wxWidgets has participated in the [[Google Summer of Code]] since 2006.{{cite web|last=Smart|first=Julian|title=Google Summer of Code 2006: wxWidgets projects summary|url=http://wxwidgets.blogspot.com/2006/10/google-summer-of-code-2006-wxwidgets.html|publisher=wxwidgets.org|accessdate=2011-04-11|date=2006-10-10}}{{cite web|title=Google Summer of Code 2006|url=http://code.google.com/intl/pl/soc/2006/wxwidgets/about.html|accessdate=2011-04-11}} {{Prose|date=June 2011}} The following table contains the release history of wxWidgets, showing all of its major release versions. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 85%; text-align: center;" ! Version number ! Date ! Notable changes |- ! Project started by Julian Smart | 1992{{cite web|title=History of wxWidgets|url=http://www.wxwidgets.org/about/history.htm|publisher=wxWidgets.org|accessdate=2011-04-11}} | |- !colspan="3" style="background:#C0C0C0"|wxWindows 1 |- ! Alpha 1 | 5 April 1997{{cite web|title=wxWidgets Change Log|url=http://svn.wxwidgets.org/svn/wx/wxWidgets/trunk/docs/changes.txt|publisher=wxWidgets.org|accessdate=2011-04-11}} | |- ! Beta 1 | 24 December 1998 | |- !colspan="3" style="background:#C0C0C0"|wxWidgets 2 |- ! 2.0.1 | 1 March 1999 | |- ! 2.2.0 | 9 July 2000{{cite web|title=News|url=http://www.wxwidgets.org/about/news/news.htm|publisher=wxWidgets.org|accessdate=2011-04-11}} | |- ! 2.4.0 | 6 January 2003 | |- ! 2.6.0 | 21 April 2005 | |- ! 2.8.0 | 14 December 2006{{cite web|last=Sudiarto Raharjo|first=Willy|title=WxWidgets 2.8.0|url=http://slackblogs.blogspot.com/2006/12/wxwidgets-280.html|accessdate=2011-04-11|date=2006-12-14}} | * wxAUI library. * Generic wxRichTextCtrl. * wxComboCtrl with custom, graphical comboboxes. * Further functionality including wxAnimationCtrl, wxSimpleHtmlListBox, wxHyperlinkCtrl, wxColourPickerCtrl, wxDirPickerCtrl, wxFilePickerCtrl, wxFontPickerCtrl, wxCollapsiblePane, wxSearchCtrl, wxAboutBox, wxTreebook, tar streams. |- !colspan="3" style="background:#C0C0C0"|Future versions |- ! 3.0 | End of 2011{{cite web|title=wxWidgets Roadmap|url=http://trac.wxwidgets.org/wiki/Roadmap|accessdate=2011-07-28}} | * GTK+ 3 port * Transparent Unicode support. * Unification of Debug/Release builds. * Cocoa-based wxOSX port running in 64 bit mode. * PersistentControls. * Support for window-modal and application-modal dialogs. * wxRibbon - [[Ribbon_(computing)|Ribbon]] implementation * wxPropertyGrid |- ! 3.2 | | * Drop Win9x platform support. * Drop Microsoft Visual C++ 6.0 support. |- |} ==License== {{Further|[http://www.wxwidgets.org/newlicen.htm wxWindows License]}} wxWidgets is distributed under a custom made ''wxWindows License'', similar to the [[GNU Lesser General Public License]], with an exception stating that derived works in [[binary file|binary form]] may be distributed on the user's own terms. This [[software license|license]] is a [[free software license]], making wxWidgets [[free software]].{{cite web | url = http://www.wxwidgets.org/about/newlicen.htm |title = "License" page on website | quote = The wxWindows License is essentially the L-GPL (Library General Public License), with an exception stating that derived works in binary form may be distributed on the user's own terms. }} It has been approved by the [[Open Source Initiative]] (OSI).{{cite web|title=Open Source Initiative OSI - The wxWindows Library Licence:Licensing|url=http://www.opensource.org/licenses/wxwindows.php|publisher=Open Source Initiative|accessdate=2011-04-28}} Its name will be changed to ''wxWidgets Licence''. ==Official support== ===Supported platforms=== wxWidgets is supported on the following platforms.{{cite web|title=wxWidgets - General FAQ|url=http://www.wxwidgets.org/docs/faqgen.htm|publisher=wxwidgets.org|accessdate=2011-04-29}} * '''Windows''' - wxMSW (Windows 95/98/ME, NT, 2000, XP, and Vista) * '''Linux/Unix''' wxGTK+, wxX11, wxMotif * '''Mac OS X''' - wxMac (10.3 using Carbon) * '''OS/2''' - wxOS2, wxPM, wxWidgets for GTK+ or Motif can be compiled on OS/2 * '''Embedded platforms''' - wxEmbedded ====External ports==== * '''Amiga''' - wxWidgets-AOS: AmigaOS port{{cite web|title=wxWidgets-AOS: AmigaOS port|url=http://sourceforge.net/projects/wxwidget-aos/|accessdate=2011-04-24}} ===Supported compilers=== {{see also2|[http://wiki.wxwidgets.org/Development:_Supported_Classes Supported classes by wxWidgets' ports]}} wxWidgets is officially confirmed to work properly with the following compilers.{{cite web|title=Supported Platforms|url=http://wiki.wxwidgets.org/Supported_Platforms|publisher=wxwidgets.org|accessdate=2011-04-24}} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 85%; width: auto;" |- ! colspan=2 | wxMSW ! colspan=2 | wxGTK |- ! Compiler ! Version ! Compiler ! Version |- valign="top" | [[Microsoft Visual Studio]] - [[Visual C++]]
[[Borland C++]]
[[Borland C++ Builder]]
[[Watcom C/C++ compiler|Watcom C++]], [[OpenWatcom]]
[[CodeWarrior]]
[[Cygwin]]
[[MinGW]]

IBM XL C/C++ | 2.95 +
5.9
3.80
8.00 |} ==Implementation== [[File:WxPython-logo.png|thumb|right|150px|[[wxPython]] logo]] The wxWidgets [[Library (computing)|library]] is implemented in [[C++]], with [[Language binding|bindings]] available for many commonly used [[programming language]]s. Some of them:{{cite web|title=wxWidgets General Information|url=http://wiki.wxwidgets.org/General_Information|publisher=wxwidgets.org|accessdate=2011-04-11}} {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size: 85%; text-align: center; width: auto;" |- !Language !Binding !Latest release !Latest release date |- |[[Python (programming language)|Python]] |[[wxPython]] |2.8.12.1 |2011-07-23{{cite web|title=wxPython|url=http://www.wxpython.org/|accessdate=2011-08-14}} |- |[[PHP (programming language)|PHP]] |[[wxPHP]] |1.1 |2011-09-22{{cite web|title=wxPHP|url=http://www.wxphp.org/|accessdate=2011-09-22}} |- |[[Erlang (programming language)|Erlang]] |wxErlang |R14B03 |2011-05-25{{cite web|title=Erlang -- wx the erlang binding of wxWidgets|url=http://www.erlang.org/doc/apps/wx/chapter.html|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |[[Haskell (programming language)|Haskell]] |[[wxHaskell]] |0.12.1.2 |2009-10-13{{cite web|title=WxHaskell - HaskellWiki|url=http://haskell.org/haskellwiki/WxHaskell|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |[[Tcl]] |wxTCL | |{{cite web|title=wx Extension for Tcl|url=http://membres.lycos.fr/awaken/|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |[[Lua (programming language)|Lua]] |wxLua |2.8.10.0 |2009-05-24{{cite web|title=wxLua - homepage|url=http://wxlua.sourceforge.net/|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |[[Perl]] |[[wxPerl]] |0.98 |2010-08-18{{cite web|title=wxPerl|url=http://wxperl.sourceforge.net/|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |[[Ruby (programming language)|Ruby]] |wxRuby |2.0.1 |2009-09-08{{cite web|title=wxRubyWiki: wxRuby|url=http://wxruby.rubyforge.org/wiki/wiki.pl|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |[[Smalltalk]] |wxSqueak |0.5.1 |2008-07-06{{cite web|title=wxSqueak official website|url=http://www.wxsqueak.org/|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |[[BASIC|Basic]] |[[wxBasic]] |2.8.10.23 |2009-09-06{{cite web|title=wxBasic Programming Language|url=http://wxbasic.net/download.html|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |[[Blitz_BASIC|BlitzMax]] |wxMax |1.01 |2009-10{{cite web|title= wxmax - BlitzMax binding for wxWidgets|url=http://code.google.com/p/wxmax/|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |[[C (programming language)|C]] |wxC | |{{cite web|title=wxC official website|url=http://wxc.sourceforge.net/|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |[[D (programming language)|D]] |wxD |0.15 |2009-07-03{{cite web|title=wxD - Cross-Platform GUI Library|url=http://wxd.sourceforge.net/|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |[[Euphoria (programming language)|Euphoria]] |wxEuphoria |0.16.0 |2011-06-20{{cite web|title=wxEuphoria official website|url=http://wxeuphoria.sourceforge.net/|accessdate=2011-08-14}} |- |[[.NET Framework]] |wx.NET |0.9.2 |2010-07-14{{cite web|title=wx.NET Home Page|url=http://wxnet.sourceforge.net/|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |[[Java (programming language)|Java]] |wx4j |0.2.0 |2004-04-01{{cite web|title=wx4j: A Java Binding for wxWidgets|url=http://wx4j.sourceforge.net/|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |[[JavaScript]] |wxJavaScript |0.9.75 |2008-12-09{{cite web|title=wxJavaScript official website|url=http://www.wxjavascript.net/|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |[[JavaScript]] |[[GLUEscript]] |0.1.08 |2011-02-18{{cite web|title=GLUEscript - Glueing Libraries Using EcmaScript|url=http://gluescript.sourceforge.net/|accessdate=2011-04-12}} |- |} wxWidgets is best described as a [[native mode]] toolkit as it provides a thin abstraction to a platform's native widgets, contrary to emulating the display of widgets using graphic primitives. Calling a native widget on the target platform results in a more native looking interface than toolkits such as [[Swing (Java)|Swing]] (for Java), as well as offering performance and other benefits.{{cite web |url=http://wiki.wxwidgets.org/WxWidgets_Compared_To_Other_Toolkits |title=WxWidgets Compared To Other Toolkits |publisher=wxwidgets.org |accessdate=2010-01-02 }} The toolkit is also not restricted to GUI development, having an [[inter-process communication]] layer, [[internet socket|socket]] networking functionality, and more. ==RAD tools and IDEs for wxWidgets== [[Image:Codelite2.0-Screenshot.png|thumb|right|215px|[[CodeLite]] under Windows XP]] {{rellink|1=See also: [http://wiki.codeblocks.org/index.php?title=Comparison_of_wxSmith_features Comparison of wxWidgets RAD solutions]}} There are many [[Rapid Application Development]] (RAD) and [[Integrated Development Environment]] (IDE) tools available, among them:{{cite web|title=Tools for wxWidgets|url=http://wiki.wxwidgets.org/Tools|publisher=wxWidgets.org|accessdate=2011-04-12}}{{cite web|title=List of Integrated Development Environments|url=http://wiki.wxwidgets.org/List_of_Integrated_Development_Environments|publisher=wxWidgets.org|accessdate=2011-04-12}} * [[Boa Constructor]] ([[Python (programming language)|Python]]) * [[Code::Blocks]] (via wxSmith plugin) * [[CodeLite]] * [[wxDev-C++]] (Plugin) * [[wxGlade]] * [[wxFormBuilder]] * [[Philasmicos Entwickler Studio]] ==Applications built using wxWidgets== [[Image:Audacity Ubuntu.png|thumb|right|215px|[[Audacity]] running under [[Ubuntu]]]] [[File:TrueCrypt on windows vista.png|thumb|right|215px|[[TrueCrypt]] on Windows Vista]] {{see also2|[[:Category:Software that uses wxWidgets|Category: Software that uses wxWidgets]]|[http://www.wxwidgets.org/about/screensh.htm wxWidgets Applications]|[http://wxwidgets.org/about/users.htm wxWidgets Users]|[http://wiki.wxwidgets.org/Commercial_applications_using_wxWidgets Commercial applications using wxWidgets]}} Notable applications that use wxWidgets: * [[Amaya (web browser)|Amaya]] - web authoring tool * [[aMule]] - peer-to-peer file sharing application * [[Audacity]] - cross-platform sound editor * [[BitTorrent (software)|BitTorrent]] - peer-to-peer file sharing application * [[Code::Blocks]] - C/C++ IDE * [[CodeLite]] - simple C++ Editor (Collection of free Tools, implemented by plugins) * [[Dolphin (emulator)|Dolphin]] - Nintendo GameCube, Wii, and Triforce emulator * [[Digsby]] - multiprotocol instant messaging application * [[FileZilla]] - FTP client * [[RapidSVN]] - Subversion client * [[TortoiseCVS]] - CVS client * [[TrueCrypt]] - application used for [[on-the-fly encryption]] ==See also== {{Portal|Free software}} * [[Widget toolkit]] * [[List of widget toolkits]] * [[Qt (toolkit)]] - an application framework used by [[KDE]] applications * [[GTK+]] - the GIMP toolkit, a widget toolkit used by [[GNOME]] applications * [[gtkmm]] - C++ version of GTK+ * [[FLTK]] - a light, cross platform, non-native widget toolkit * [[FOX toolkit]] - a fast, open source, cross-platform widget toolkit * [[Ultimate++]] * [[Juce]] - an extensive cross-platform widget toolkit * [[Microsoft litigation]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==Further reading== *{{Citation | first1 = Julian | last1 = Smart | first2 = Kevin | last2 = Hock | first3 = Stefan | last3 = Csomor | title = Cross-Platform GUI Programming with wxWidgets | edition = | date = August 5, 2005 | publisher = [[Prentice Hall]] | pages = 744 | isbn = 978-0131473812 | url = }} ==External links== {{Commons category|wxWidgets}} * {{Official website|wxwidgets.org}} * [http://forums.wxwidgets.org wxForum] - official forum * [http://wxwidgets.blogspot.com/ wxBlog] - official blog * [http://wiki.wxwidgets.org/Main_Page wxWiki] - a wiki devoted to the wxWidgets project * [http://wxcode.sourceforge.net/ wxCode] - code snippets and libraries related to wxWidgets * [http://wxpack.sourceforge.net/ wxPack] - a complete ready-to-use wxWidgets [[Software development kit|development kit]] * [http://trac.wxwidgets.org/wiki wxTrac] - issue tracker (for reporting bugs, submitting patches) * [http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/library/l-wxwidgets/index.html Build cross-platform GUIs using wxWidgets] - a quick tutorial * [http://wiki.wxwidgets.org/WxWidgets_Compared_To_Other_Toolkits wxWidgets compared to other toolkits] {{wxWidgets}} {{Widget toolkits}}
